definition: busy season/peak period/see also 淡季[dan4 ji4]
season/the last month of a season/fourth or youngest amongst brothers/classifier for seasonal crop yields

sentences.english: In summer days when the trees grow fast, temperature is relatively low and heat unadequate.

sentences.english: A tourist attraction have any off-season and peak seasons.
sentences.chinese: 任何一個旅遊景點都有淡季和旺季之分。

sentences.english: Im afraid were fully booked for that time. Its the hot season, you know.

sentences.english: We have to have the merchandise ready for the Christmas sales blitz.

sentences.english: WL: I think the first thing is don't go there when it's a really busy time.

sentences.english: Current, line of business of company of province straight aquatic product already entered production busy season and management busy season.

sentences.english: To balance staff working schedule to meet peak and slack periods and maintain a close payroll control.

sentences.english: All room rates are subject to change without prior notice.
sentences.chinese: 以上房價隨淡旺季折扣，恕不另行通知。

sentences.english: They always want to buy the lower - priced product no matter in the rush season or the off-season .
sentences.chinese: 他們不論淡旺季都會有着同樣的低價格需求的。

sentences.english: This is the high season, you know. Almost all of our cars have been reserved.
sentences.chinese: 現在是旺季，基本上我們的車全被訂了。

definition: off season/slow business season/see also 旺季[wang4 ji4]
to appreciate (in value)/to increase in price
